column4: Question: I have ubuntu-6.06-alternate-powerpc. How do I set up ANY sort of server to get data off the hard drive without destroying it. I also have ubuntu-6.06-desktop-powerpc...
that's not very clear? what OS is installed *now*?
a broken ass OS X.
and you want to read HFS+ from a LiveCD? good luck.
I can read it with both these.
have you run Disk Utility from the OSX install CD/DVD?
it keeps saying it has lost connection with the daemon.
what do you have to copy the files onto? a CD? a remote machine? USB stick?
uhm, a remote machine is best.
so install an OpenSSH server on that remote machine and scp the files over
there's an ssh server on the machine?
you want the desktop cd, not the alternate
I've got that here too, and was told I needed alternate yesterday.
so using desktop, how do I stop it from trying to access esd?
why is a sound subsystem a problem?
no idea, but that's apprently the problem.
what kind of Mac?
iMac G5 first gen (no iSight)
weird, i know people using 6.06 with the iMac G5r1
well... I dunno. I can boot into rescue mode, and it bitches when I select any of the options, but I can execute commands in that built in mini-shell thing
so then use that to scp files to a remote machine running an ssh server
I don't know how, it's the shell off the install thing. It doesn't even have ping.
